sub_title: Engineering Manager @Booking.com | Pragmatic and servant engineering leader with 10+ years of experience. Passionate about building high-performing teams that make amazing things.
summary:
I am a pragmatic software engineer. I am passionate about creating quality software that brings value and helps businesses achieve their goals.

I am equally comfortable talking to customers, making technical decisions, and leading & mentoring software engineers.

I strongly believe that the key to a successful product organisation is through empowered teams. I establish psychological safety within my teams, where people can voice and pursue their ideas, have a margin to fail and learn from their mistakes. I believe in describing goals rather than telling what to do. I lead by example and celebrate as a team.

I am a master generalist, excited by the fine balance between hard and soft skills.

projects.title: Pet Projects
projects.description:
Technologies: Asp.Net MVC, Asp.Net Web Api, Asp.Net Web Forms, Windows Phone SDK, SignalR, Angular.js Knockout.js, HTML5, CSS, Unity 3d, Asp.Net Identity Framework, Entity Framework, Bootstrap, JQuery, JQuery UI, Fluent Validation, Moq, Autofac, AutoMapper, DevExpress, Telerik

Projects: 
•	Currently developing a GitHub client application for windows phone.
•	My blog project, solidpatterns.net which I occasionally write about software and technology
•	Developed a GitHub Viewer application using Angular.js, Bootstrap and GitHub’s public api. (embed.plnkr.co/N7Lmgg/preview)
•	Developed a fluent mocked service locator for testing purposes. Used technologies are: NUnit, Moq, and Fluent Api. (with an aim to justify service locator pattern ) (github.com/SolidPatterns/MockedServiceLocator)
•	Anxiety-driven-growth. Heavy R&D about software architecture and web technologies to achieve 20% or more self-improvement (in terms of wisdom, knowledge and also practice) a year.
•	Developed a chat app using HTML5, SignalR, Knockout, and Asp.Net WebApi. (hamzatalk.azurewebsites.net/HamzaTalk - github.com/SolidPatterns/HamzaTalk)
•	Developed a zombie survival game using Unity3d with C#.
•	Implemented loosely coupled and highly abstract custom Asp.Net Identity Framework (claims based authentication, Asp.Net Identity Framework, TPL) – soon open source
•	My friend and I developed an n-tier framework. By using our framework we developed a pre-accountancy and ERP for gas stations (Asp.Net MVC) project which is being used more than 30 gas stations in Turkey. We also converted our project to Asp.Net Web Forms (MVP Passive Pattern) to assert our framework worked that way too.

projects.title: GDS (Coral Travel - Russia)
projects.description:
Technologies: Asp.Net MVC, Asp.Net WebApi, Knockout JS, Knockout Validation, JQuery, JQuery UI, Require JS, Entity Framework, Mongo DB, Redis, Log4Net, Fluent Validation, ELMAH, OAuth, OWIN - Katana, Thinktecture, Asp.Net Identity Framework, Autofac, AutoMapper, Bootstrap, Razor, NUnit, Moq, Kendo, SignalR, Quartz.Net, Post Sharp

Global Distribution System (B2B – B2C) project that enables users to buy flight tickets, book hotels, arrange transfers and also buy train tickets. This project is going to be used by 30.000 travel agencies in Russia.

o	Designed the software architecture and project structure, decided the technology stack, contributed intensively
o	Designed and composed the project structure
o	Designed and developed the framework (Oti Framework) that is used to develop this project
o	Developed whole authentication, authorization, user management, claims management, scopes management, messaging, order histories and details  parts of the project (OAuth, token based authentication – claims)
o	Developed front-end JavaScript library for the team’s ease of use
o	Helped the team to achieve understanding about the technologies that are used
o	Helped the team with their technical problems
o	Developed needed back-end and front-end services for the team
o	Conducted code review sessions

projects.title: Oti Framework
projects.description:
Technologies: Asp.Net, Asp.Net MVC, Asp.Net WebApi, TPL, Asp.Net Identity Framework,  Inversion of Control, Entity Framework, Redis, Mongo Db, Automapper, Autofac, Fluent Validation, OAuth, Owin-Katana, Thinktecture,  Log4Net, ELMAH, Quartz.Net, PostSharp, Kendo (fluent api impl with Knockout support), KnockoutJS (for custom binding handlers for Kendo),  NUnit, Moq, Service Stack 

Methodologies: TDD, Agile
Patterns: Unit of Work, Repository, Decorator, Façade, Adapter, Abstract Factory, Template Method, Strategy, Singleton, Dependency Injection, Service Locator…

Some of the libraries from framework project:
o	Mongo DB, Redis, Entity Framework wrappers, facades, adapters, extensions and helpers
o	Unit of work and repository pattern implementations
o	OAuth, Owin - Katana libraries
o	Microsoft Asp.Net Identity Framework implementation from scratch
o	Inversion of control library (abstracts away Autofac, and bootstraps everything from framework level)
o	Logging library which uses log4net integrated with MongoDB
o	Mapping library which uses AutoMapper and provides useful extensions.
o	Resource management library 
And many more such as, infrastructure, core, security, test suite…

projects.title: Unipa CRM System
projects.description: Used by all customers and all project groups – University Project Group (31 universities), Hospital Project Group (12 hospitals), Municipal Project Group (45 municipals)- of Unipa to report bugs and issue tasks. This project is integrated with TFS so that entries from customers can be converted into tasks and bugs and managed easily.

projects.description:
o	Developed and maintained n-tier Application Development Framework.
This framework is being used in projects such as University Information Systems, Document Management Systems, Scientific Research Project Management Systems, and University Strategy Project. Total: 12 projects. These projects are used in 30+ universities in Turkey, Cyprus and Bosnia-Herzegovina.

projects.title: University Information Systems
projects.description:
(Used in 30+ big universities in Turkey such as Marmara University, Ege University, Samsun Ondokuz Mayis University, Sivas University, Van Yüzüncü Yıl University.)

Technologies: C#, Asp.Net Web Forms, AJAX, JQuery, TFS, NHibernate, Telerik, Fast Reports, Memcached

o	Developed and maintained more than 90 modules of this big system. One of the modules was the most crucial part of it which was registration to courses application. This application is being used by approx. 500.000 students each semester. Application was very buggy and had serious performance issues. I refactored into a maintainable and scalable application. As a result, customer satisfaction increased and the application is still stable without any issues.

projects.title: RFID Car Recognition System
projects.description:
Technologies:  Delphi, MS SQL Server 2008  

RFID Card Promotion System which allows users to apply promotion sales (car recognition system) based on the points earned by the customers to the Petronet packet software which is used by more than 1000 gas stations. NITELA RFID Card Reader and ADAM-4520 RS-232 to RS-422/485 Converter was used. Serial data communication via COM Port was developed.

projects.title: Real-time Gas Station Monitoring System
projects.description: A web application (ASP.Net & MS SQL Server 2008) in which; gas station owners whom owns (preferably) more than one gas station to monitor real-time cash flow, gas tank levels, customer ratings, gas pump attendant statistics, fuel based amount/liter statistics on a given date interval or selected shifts.

contributors.headline: Engineering Manager @Booking.com | Pragmatic and servant engineering leader with 10+ years of experience. Passionate about building high-performing teams that make amazing things.

profile_positions.description: At Booking.com, we’re not just a platform for booking accommodation – we’re the technology that makes travel easier. We’re the thrill of the first night in a new place. The excitement of the next morning. The friends you make. The journeys you take. The sights you see. And the food you sample. We make it easier for everyone to experience the world.
profile_positions.title: Engineering Manager

profile_positions.description:
- Managing 18 reports (9 direct and 9 indirect)
- Achieved very low attrition (9.0 — 0.9 above benchmark — Peakon engagement score). 1 out of 9 engineers leaving in the last 2 years & 2 promotions to senior+ YTD.
- Helping our growth by hiring and onboarding engineers
- Running 2-3 projects at any given time by leading cross-functional teams. Building amazing products for the likes of Merit Circle, Otrium, KPN, Accell Group, Dutch Railways, The Cookware Company.

Technologies used: Typescript, Javascript, Node.js, GraphQL, React, Kafka, Kubernetes, Sentry, serverless, microservices, AWS Lambda, AWS SNS, Auth0, commercetools, contentful, Algolia, Python, Django, AWS S3
profile_positions.title: Principal Solutions Architect & Partner

profile_positions.description:
- Managed a team of 6 direct reports
- Hiring and onboarding engineers
- Running 2 projects at any given time by leading cross-functional teams. Building custom web applications, e-commerce platforms, mobile apps for the likes of Eneco, Oxxio, Woonzorg, Bugaboo, Jaarbeurs, CBRE, ANWB
- Used strangler fig pattern to transform an old monolith into 6 new microservices
- Introduced saga pattern, queues, and DLQ to the order flow which reduced checkout abandonment by 80%

Technologies used: C#, .Net Core, Azure, Javascript, React, microservices, DDD, TDD, CQRS, event-driven architecture, strangler fig pattern, Apigee, Microsoft Bot Framework, MS LUIS, Cosmos Db, Redis, Event grid, Event hub, Service bus, message queues, Git, Azure DevOps
profile_positions.title: Senior Solutions Architect

profile_positions.description:
Led an agile team of 7 engineers

Implemented a bespoke B2B e-commerce platform for Unilever Food Solutions and rolled it out to more than 60 countries. The platform is being used by more than 5 million chefs, restaurants, cafes, hotel owners.

Implemented the digital experience platform of Unilever Food Solutions from the ground up and released it to more than 65 countries

My time was split between mentoring, managing expectations, grooming a high-performing team, and development. I've helped facilitate a high-performing pragmatic team by focussing on every team member (be it a developer or a project manager), trying to bring forward their strongest aspects and trying to improve the ones that were lacking. I led by example and created a culture of security within the team so that everybody could communicate their opinions freely.

I sat on the hiring committee where I interviewed business analysts, project managers, tech leads and developers.

Together with my team, we won the first Emakina hackathon. In which, we implemented a skill for Alexa called Alfred which was a voice-controlled bartender. We built the hardware that would make cocktails based on the user voice input that was passed to our software via our Amazon Alexa skill. You may find the blog post and video of Alfred below (see links).

Technologies used: Java, AEM (Adobe Experience Manager), Spring Boot Framework, Typescript, Cloud Architecture, AWS CloudSearch, AWS RDS, AWS DynamoDb, AWS Lambda Functions, AWS Elasticache, AWS EC2, AWS SES, AWS Route 53, Hibernate, Flyway, Thymeleaf, IoT, Amazon Alexa Skills, Zalenium, Bamboo, Git
profile_positions.title: Tech Lead

profile_positions.description:
Implemented the digital experience platform of Unilever Food Solutions (UFS) from the ground up and rolled it out to more than 65 countries

Implemented the core recipe and product import module which processes and indexes thousands of recipes and products daily for many countries using AWS CloudSearch

Implemented the LINQ-like query module on top of AWS cloudsearch which is powering all UFS search and filtering capabilities

Implemented UFS’ bespoke OAuth 2.0 authorization authentication module from the ground up

Improved the code coverage of the business-critical modules such as search and filtering from 30% to 70%

Technologies used: Java, AEM (Adobe Experience Manager), Spring Boot Framework, OAuth, AWS CloudSearch, AWS RDS, AWS DynamoDb, AWS Lambda Functions, AWS Elasticache, AWS EC2, AWS SES, AWS Route 53, Bamboo, Git
profile_positions.title: Senior Software Engineer

profile_positions.description:
I helped design and build a brand new booking system which enabled users to book hotels and flights tickets.  I mentored the engineering team and helped them understand the codebase, technology stack and new technologies. 

Tech buzzwords: Asp.Net MVC, Asp.Net WebApi, Entity Framework, Asp.Net Identity Framework, Owin-Katana Middleware, MongoDB, Redis, MS SQL Server, Autofac, AutoMapper, Fluent Validation, Knockout JS, Require JS, JQuery, JQuery UI

profile_positions.title: Software Engineer II

profile_positions.description:
I helped build and maintain one of the major higher education ERP software in Turkey. My responsibility included maintaining and developing many critical modules of the system including registration to courses module (which has complex algorithms that determines which courses a student can pick etc), which was being used by millions of students during registration periods.

Tech buzzwords: Asp.Net Web Forms (C#), .Net Framework 3.5, DDD Framework, AJAX, JQuery, TFS, NHibernate, Telerik, Fast Reports, Memcached
profile_positions.title: Software Engineer
